title: How_To_Use_Track_Camera_In_AE
content:
Using Conventional Methods

Import your video file then click Track Camera

And then waiting AE Analysis(If fail, please chose Detailed Analysis)

When a bunch of points appears, box the area you want to stick the tracking to, then right-click and select Create Soild and Camera

AE will create a solid layer and a camera for you. Create a new text layer and turn on its 3D layer switch.

Hold down the Shift key and link the text to the solid layer.

Immediately afterward, the text was pasted onto a solid layer.
Like this

Turn off the visibility of the solid layer and adjust the various properties of the text according to your own situation.

Result Show

Using Special tool

Some Minecraft mods support exporting AE keyframes, such as Aperture. Although the native version of Blockbuster Studio does not, a developer in China created a feature to export AE keyframes for this purpose.

I’m using the features he developed.

His GIthub:https://github.com/Yancey2023/bbs-ae-keyframe
